framework.control

Class ControlInterfaceActionHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • framework.control.ControlInterfaceActionHandler

  • final class ControlInterfaceActionHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds all methods for control interfaces and is mainly used by the ControlInterfaceConnector. It also excessively checks system states and control interface rights with every call.

    TODO:
    - Log to System.out/err if there are no CIs that have listeners registered.
    - Reevaluate the announcement system, should we really use Threads/Services for this?

    Author:
    Stefan Werner

    • Method Detail

      • addConnection

        boolean addConnection(java.lang.String ciId,
                      ConnectionSummary connectionSummary)
               throws AuthorizationException,
                      ControlInterfaceException
        Adds a module connection.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP

        Required rights: MANAGE_MODULES_AND_CONNECTIONS

        Parameters:
        ciId - the calling CI ID
        connectionSummary - the connection summary
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • addControlInterface

        java.lang.String addControlInterface(java.lang.String ciId,
                                     java.lang.String ciType,
                                     int rights)
                              throws AuthorizationException,
                                     ControlInterfaceException
        Adds a new control interface.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING

        Required rights: MANAGE_CIS

        Parameters:
        ciId - the calling CI ID
        ciType - the CI type
        rights - the rights
        Returns:
        the CI ID
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • addGeneralEventListener

        boolean addGeneralEventListener(java.lang.String ciId,
                                GeneralEventListener generalEventListener,
                                GeneralEventType... desiredEventTypes)
                         throws AuthorizationException,
                                ControlInterfaceException
        Adds a general event listener.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING

        Required rights: RCV_CONN_UPDATE, RCV_LOG_EVENT, RCV_MOD_ACT, RCV_MOD_AND_PORT_UPDATE (depends on event type)

        IMPORTANT: You can actually skip desiredEventTypes or just use framework.model.event.type.GeneralEventType.GeneralEvent to add an "catch all" listener but this is discouraged to avoid flooding with unnecessary event. Of course CI will only receive events it holds appropriate rights for.

        Parameters:
        ciId - the calling CI ID
        generalEventListener - the general event listener
        desiredEventTypes - the desired event types
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

        ModuleSummary addModule(java.lang.String ciId,

        Parameters:

        moduleType - the module type
        rights - the rights
        Returns:
        the module summary
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • exit

        void exit(java.lang.String ciId,
          boolean force)
   throws AuthorizationException,
          ControlInterfaceException
        Exits the system.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP, BROKER_RUNNING

        Required rights: CONTROL_STATE

        Parameters:
        ciId - the calling CI ID
        force - set to true to force exit even if components fail to stop
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • exportConfiguration

        boolean exportConfiguration(java.lang.String ciId,
                            java.io.OutputStream out,
                            boolean exportPortConnections,
                            java.util.Set<java.lang.String> moduleIdsToExport,
                            java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ciIdsToExport)
                     throws AuthorizationException
        Exports configuration.

        Required rights: MANAGE_DATABASE

        Parameters:
        ciId - the calling CI ID
        out - the output stream to write to
        exportPortConnections - set to true to export port connections
        moduleIdsToExport - the module IDs to export
        ciIdsToExport - the CI IDs to export
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient

      • getSupportedControlInterfaceCommands

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSupportedControlInterfaceCommands(java.lang.String ciId,
                                                                     java.lang.String moduleId)
                                                              throws AuthorizationException,
                                                                     ControlInterfaceException
        Gets the supported control interface commands from a given module.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP

        Required rights: MANAGE_MODULES_AND_CONNECTIONS

        Parameters:
        ciId - the calling CI ID
        moduleId - the module ID
        Returns:
        the supported control interface commands (may be null, for example if module does not answer before a timeout occurs)
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • sendControlInterfaceCommand

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sendControlInterfaceCommand(java.lang.String ciId,
                                                                             java.lang.String moduleId,
                                                                             java.lang.String command,
                                                                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
                                                                      throws AuthorizationException,
                                                                             ControlInterfaceException
        Sends control interface command to given module.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP

        Required rights: MANAGE_MODULES_AND_CONNECTIONS

        Parameters:
        ciId - the calling CI ID
        moduleId - the module ID to send command to
        command - the command
        properties - the properties (may be null)
        Returns:
        the answer from module (may be null, for example if module does not answer before a timeout occurs)
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • setComponentInstanceManager

        void setComponentInstanceManager(ComponentInstanceManager manager)
        Sets the component instance manager.
        Parameters:
        manager - the new component instance manager

      • setControlInterfaceRights

        boolean setControlInterfaceRights(java.lang.String ownCIId,
                                  java.lang.String otherCIId,
                                  int newRights)
                           throws AuthorizationException,
                                  ControlInterfaceException
        Sets the rights of a given control interface.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING

        Required rights: MANAGE_CIS

        Parameters:
        ownCIId - the own CI ID
        otherCIId - the other CI ID to set rights for
        newRights - the new rights
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • setModuleRights

        boolean setModuleRights(java.lang.String ciId,
                        java.lang.String moduleId,
                        int newRights)
                 throws AuthorizationException,
                        ControlInterfaceException
        Sets the rights of a given module.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP, SystemStateType.BROKER_RUNNING

        Required rights: MANAGE_MODULES_AND_CONNECTIONS

        Parameters:
        ciId - the calling CI ID
        moduleId - the module ID to set rights for
        newRights - the new rights
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • startBroker

        void startBroker(java.lang.String ciId)
          throws AuthorizationException,
                 ControlInterfaceException
        Starts broker.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP, BROKER_RUNNING

        Required rights: CONTROL_STATE

        Parameters:
        ciId - the calling CI ID
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error

      • stopBroker

        void stopBroker(java.lang.String ciId)
         throws AuthorizationException,
                ControlInterfaceException
        Stops broker.

        Disallowed in states: SYSTEM_EXITING, SYSTEM_INITIALIZING, BROKER_SHUTTING_DOWN, ROKER_STARTING_UP, BROKER_STOPPED_AND_READY

        Required rights: CONTROL_STATE

        Parameters:
        ciId - the calling CI ID
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException - if rights are insufficient
        ControlInterfaceException - if in wrong state, illegal arguments given or some other error
